level.text: Pursuant to the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended, an applicant or consumer who is dissatisfied with any determination concerning the furnishing or denial of vocational rehabilitation services has the right to pursue mediation prior to pursuing an impartial due process hearing.
Mediation is voluntary for both parties and therefore, at any time during the mediation process, either party or the mediator may elect to terminate the mediation.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 38 DCR 2034 (April 5, 1991); as amended by 54 DCR 6020 (June 22, 2007); as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 57 DCR 4612, 4618 (May 28, 2010).
